newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakhs want speedy entry to WTO - prime minister.
newsitem.headline: Kazakhs want speedy entry to WTO - prime minister.

text.p: Kazakh Prime Minister Akezhan Kazhegeldin said on Friday the oil-rich former Soviet republic wanted speedy entry into the World Trade Organisation (WTO).
"We are compelled to this by Kazakhstan's economic structure, where 60 percent of output is intended for export," Kazhegeldin told a meeting of diplomats and reporters.
Kazakhstan held its first round of negotiations on WTO membership in Geneva last month. A second round of talks is due in September or October.
"We received a positive opinion of the reforms being carried out in Kazakhstan and support for our efforts to join the WTO," he said.
Kazhegeldin said he expected the WTO to grant Kazakhstan transition economy status.
Some international steel-producing countries have complained that Kazakhstan has in the past sent large quantities of steel onto world markets and depressed prices.
